title: For Indians, which of the 2 eras was better, the Mughal Era or the British colonial era? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh definitely the Mughal era was much better for India. I’d keep it short and simple. Mughals were nomads from the middle east. They won wars in India, conquered territories and decided to settle in India. They knew that for their own good, It was important to make India and Indians grow. With their economic policies in the right place they made things taxable (which was ok) and facilitated trade around the world. By doing this they made wealth from all over the world come to India. Around the beginning of the 17th century, India’s share in the world economy grew to It was 27%, and was about 23% in late 1790s. It is said that the amount of tax collected by Aurangzeb amounted to about £100 Million only. India prospered amazingly well in economic terms during the Mughal reign. And was destroyed by the British in 200 years. Britain, when the East India Company came to India was very poor. It accounted for 1.8% of global economy. By the time they left India in 1947, they accounted for 10% while they turned India into a third world country. Here are some important points: Between 1757 and 1900 British GDP per capita increased by 347% in real terms. For India it was only 14%Between 1900–1947 India grew at less than 1% whereas Britain grew at 3.5%They knew the only way to get some money in the economy was trade and they could go to any extent for that. The British imposed huge taxes on Indian goods, gave preferencial treatment to British goods,De-industrialised India,pushed a large population into farming and made them grow stuff in high demand in Britain (and on top of that they were taxed heavily),they introduced corruption to India and brought the VIP culture.Britain used Indian resources in the 2 world wars and never paid the money it owed in full.Behaved like animals (kept buffer food stocks to be sent to London) and let millions of Indians die in the Bengal FamineDivided Hindus & Muslims and facilitated riots for decadesDivided India. Left millions deadHowever since they’ve left, we’ve grown slowly but very well. British left India with 16% literacy rate. Today it is about 72%British left India with 27 year life expectancy, today it is thrice of that90% people lived below poverty line in 1947. Today India has pulled 28- Million people out of poverty.Britain only got 1500 villages electrified but today it’s about 320 times of that numberPS: Many people would argue that the British gave India Railways, English language, education system and what not. But the truth is, they had no option but to throw this on India. They needed railways to get stuff to the ports. English to facilitate movement of goods & people and administration and an education system that’d restrict creative thinking and prepare people to take commands. Source: An era of darkness by Shashi Tharoor
